stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the stream gray-boxing, texturing and planning the new Oil-Rig course, while starting a general ‘polish phase’.  He tweaks fog, lighting and camera code, then collaboratively blocks out Bowser’s office tower and an oil-monster boss fight.  Zeina checks in about needed animations; Biobak gives art feedback.  Kaze also talks about project scope, Nintendo legal worries, and his own work-life balance.

development_findings.summary: A new ‘polish phase’ has started: older retro areas will be remade at larger scale to match newer levels.
Fog colour was changed to blue and lights were re-tuned; camera wall-occlusion logic now ignores inside geometry, improving visibility.
development_findings.quote: I decided to update the fog and I think this looks a lot better … only outside level geometry is gonna block the camera.

development_findings.summary: Oil-Rig level layout: switch-controlled crane, wrecking-ball set-piece, multi-entrance underwater section used as quick-travel, secret 8-bit pipe, red-coin path and power generator sub-area.
Boss concept locked in: a gargantuan oil Blarg/Block that emerges when a strike platform sinks.  Mario rides a spawned soap bar to chase and shrink it; minions may throw the soap.
development_findings.quote: Every now and then a soap bar spawns.  If you’re on the soap bar you can chase him … when he shrinks all the way he dies.

development_findings.summary: Design pivot: Bowser’s ‘castle’ replaced by a tall office tower with horned roof; interior easter-eggs (desk, mugs, Peach photo) visible from a crane but only partly explorable.
development_findings.quote: I completely changed the way the fog works … and I think the office tower idea is better than another full castle.

development_findings.summary: Technical refactor: updating libultra translation-matrix code broke the old cannon reticle; Kaze plans to rebuild the entire recticle and cannon camera.
development_findings.quote: I updated all the lib ultra things … kind of broke the old rectacle … I’m just gonna remake that whole cannon rectacle.

development_findings.summary: Performance/asset decisions: icospheres chosen over UV spheres for round objects; vertex-colour gradients may be used instead of heavy geometry for oil wave shading.
development_findings.quote: I have an icosphere – they are a little bit rounder looking for less triangles, so icospheres are just better.

development_findings.summary: Game progress estimate: roughly two-thirds complete after nearly three years; at least 1–1.5 years of work remain, partly because Kaze works full-time at Gears for Breakfast.
development_findings.quote: We are only two-thirds through the game … realistically it’s still gonna be at least like a year and a half.

context_findings.summary: Kaze claims discipline over motivation: ‘I’m not motivated at all … you need to work without motivation.’
context_findings.quote: You’re physically capable of working, so why aren’t you? That’s how I approach it.

context_findings.summary: He holds a full-time Unreal Engine programming job at Gears for Breakfast, limiting hack hours to evenings/weekends and holidays.
context_findings.quote: I do have a full-time job so I can’t spend that much time on it.

context_findings.summary: Kaze monetises through YouTube ads/Patreon; plans to open-source the hack only after release to reduce Nintendo risk and avoid spoilers.
context_findings.quote: I will open-source it once it is released but not before because I would just be leaking my entire mod … also for, you know, Nintendo.

context_findings.summary: Personal dynamics: lighthearted banter with spouse/animator Zeina (she jokes about him being ‘stinky’, he says she’s a ‘loudmouth’).  They leave early for a double birthday party.
Cultural/linguistic note: German native living in Canada; avoids speaking German on stream so viewers aren’t excluded.
context_findings.quote: I try not to speak German on stream because … it feels a bit exclusionary.

biobak.summary: Reviewed and refined Kaze’s models (fog, textures) and suggested adding horn silhouettes to Bowser’s office tower; acts as regular art quality gate.
biobak.quote: My couch a lot with the models – whenever I finish a model he’s looking over it again and makes it a lot prettier.

biobak.summary: Proposed an alternate oil-rig underground arena mock-up and a dynamic colour-shift idea for the oil surface.

zeina.summary: Provides character animation; confirmed Bowser idle/shout animations finished and volunteered to animate Buzzy Beetle NPCs next.
zeina.quote: I can’t think of any other animations I need right now … The Buzzy Beetles should be pretty simple.

zeina.summary: Assists off-stream and participates in design chat; friendly marital banter visible on stream.

key_stories.title: Birth of the Oil-Block Boss
key_stories.summary: While designing the oil-rig course, Kaze brainstormed a strike-breaking boss.  Chat and team steered him away from a ‘robot pipe’ gag toward a Blarg-style oil monster defeated with soap.
key_stories.challenge: Needed a boss that fits an oil-rig, Bowser’s minions, and Yoshi’s Island heritage.
key_stories.process: Considered Boom-Boom, Bob-ombs and joke ideas before settling on an Oil Blarg.  Iterated on mechanics: waves, shrinking, soap bar vehicle, minion supply.
key_stories.outcome: Core concept, attack patterns and arena design locked in; implementation slated for future coding.
key_stories.key_quote: Every now and then a soap bar spawns … when you hit him with the soap bar he shrinks and eventually he just dies.

key_stories.title: Castle-to-Tower Pivot
key_stories.summary: Initial plan was a full Bowser castle embedded in the cave, but concerns over scale, performance and repetitiveness led to replacing it with a single office tower.
key_stories.challenge: Castle model felt too small and made the overworld seem ‘miniscule’.
key_stories.process: Examined mock-ups with Biobak, discussed performance; opted for a tall horned tower that serves as a visual landmark and interior gag location.
key_stories.outcome: Block-out begun; tower will house Easter eggs and strike-breaking cutscene triggers.
key_stories.key_quote: I think the office tower idea is better than another full castle.

key_stories.title: Reticle Regression
key_stories.summary: A low-level engine update unintentionally broke the cannon aiming reticle.
key_stories.challenge: Updating libultra’s translation-matrix routines disrupted existing HUD geometry.
key_stories.process: Verified cause, demonstrated bug, decided to rebuild the reticle from scratch along with new cannon camera logic.
key_stories.outcome: Task queued for technical overhaul during polish phase.
key_stories.key_quote: I kind of broke the old rectacle … I’m just gonna remake that whole cannon rectacle.
